content:
- This appeal dealt with discrimination contrary to section 15(1) of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms regarding the appellant's claim that his failure to appointment to a position in the Naval Reserve was based on his religion.
- The appellant, Lieutenant Andrew S. Liebmann, was a proven and accomplished member of the Naval Reserve and had been nominated for the important post of executive assistant to the Commander of the Canadian Forces Task Force in the Middle East during the Persian Gulf crisis.
- However, he was not appointed to the position due to his religion.
- The Court found that the refusal to appoint him to the position constituted discrimination.
- The judgment was delivered by Sexton J.A.
